dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Somebody's feeling better.  58.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I left a message for your folks. I didn’t tell ‘em anything. dust said to call me.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Really. There's nothin’ wrong with me. I just wanna get outta here. SPOONER gets up, pulls the I.V. out of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: God, that hurt.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin’, Spooner? He turns, his ASS HANGING OUT the rear of his hospital go

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I think I‘11 wait outside. ELIZABETH exits. SPOONER goes over to the window, looks o There’s a partial ocean view. In the distance, we can jus make out a gloomy HAZE building on the horizon. ©

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What is up with you?

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I mean Sean’s dead, and you're acting like nothing happened. SPOONER opens the bathroom door, takes his clothes off th hook and starts to get dressed. When he turns, there are tears in his eyes. He blinks hard, fighting back his emotions. :

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: I can’t remember what happened anymore. Like it’s just... Gone. I’m so sorry he's dead, Nick, but I didn’t kill him! You know I didn’t. I couldn’t kill anybody...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that so?. :  59. Surprised, SPOONER looks back at MALONE, who stands in th doorway. He brings in a plastic bag, lays it on the table the bed. Inside it, the BLOODY BONING KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Your knife. Found it on the boat. With Sean Reed's blood all over it... INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON ANDY stands at the glass doors staring out at the beach. MRS. KOBRITZ is watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: What did your mother want, Andy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Look at those clouds out there... MRS. KOBRITZ comes over and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: OCEAN
dialogues.text: The water is choppy and dark. On the distant horizon, we the first vestiges of a forming FOG BANK, shot through wi rays of sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: That's just the fog rolling in. MRS. KOBRITZ walks into the kitchen, leaving ANDY staring He leans in close, EXHALES ON THE WINDOW, draws something the fog...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Can I go outside?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: Just be back before dark, dear.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I will. ANDY puts on his jacket and goes out the door, and CAMERA MOVES IN on his drawing on the window. IT’S A SHIP...  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE squeals to a stop in front of the church. She gets out, gathers the wastebasket (with the journal in it) and goes to the side door. She knocks once. The DOOR SWINGS OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Father Malone? She steps inside. Very dark. Her eyes try to adjust...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Father? Her voice ECHOES off the walls. She moves through the sanctuary, turning down the long, narrow hall that leads the rectory... INT. FATHER MALONE’'S ROOM - DAY MALONE is dressed in his civvies. He takes some clothes o of his dresser, moves to the open suitcase on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Father? FATHER MALONE turns, startled to see STEVIE in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: Stevie? Stevie Wayne... My gosh, how long has it been?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: A long time, father. Too dam long.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: (smiles warmly) Please, come in.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I don’t mean to interrupt you...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. STEVIE eyes the suitcase. FATHER MALONE notices, holds hi cards.  61.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: What've you got there?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Something happened today. If I told you what, you’d think I was crazy. And maybe I am. But all I know is right now, I’m afraid for my son and I don‘t know what else to do. She dumps the wastebasket onto his desk. THE JOURNAL spil out. MALONE eyes the cover, looks up chillingly.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: In the lighthouse. Hidden ina wall.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: Hidden... MALONE reaches for it...then reconsiders. Something stirs him as eyes the name on the cover -- his family name. He looks up at STEVIE with fear in his eyes, never once touc the book...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Something’s happening, isn’t it, Father...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Then why are you leaving?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Stevie, I’m very busy right now. Maybe you should come back another time...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What's happening, Father! Tell me what I can do to protect my son!

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: Get out.  62.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: I SAID GET OUT
dialogues.text: She snatches the JOURNAL off the desk before he pushes he out and SLAMS the door, KNOCKING the book from her hand..

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE HIS DOOR
dialogues.text: She bends to pick the book, when she notices SOMETHING STICKING OUT BETWEEN THE PAGES... Hesitant, she picks it up, pulling out TWO OLD, CREASED

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHS
dialogues.text: THE FIRST is a panorama-type, taken from a hillside vanta point. It’s A FLEDGLING TOWN with a few ramshackle buildings, a muddy dirt road, a couple of mules, anda handful of people. At the bottom in white lettering it reads: ANTONIO BAY ~ 1905 THE SECOND PHOTO is of our TWELVE MEN, assembled on the beach, dressed in their turn-of-the-century finery. It lo like something is written on the reverse... STEVIE turns it over, and we can see TWELVE NAMES, in pen ink, the last of which reads PATRICK THOMAS MALONE... CuT To: INT. STEVIE’S CONVERTIBLE - DUSK STEVIE races towards town, on her celphone...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Tom Malone, please...Stevie Wayne. He's where? Thanks.. STEVIE tosses the phone. She checks her watch, then PUNCH IT, blasting right through a stop sign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH walks down the sterile hospital hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a partially open door at the far end of the corridor. Through it, ELIZABETH can see SEAN’S body lying unattended.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEAN’S BODY lies on a metal table. ELIZABETH pushes the d open and comes in. She stands there for a beat, then move tentatively, approaching her friend, seeing death up-clos for the very first time. It’s too much for her. She turns to go, tears welling in eyes, when behind her, WE SEE SEAN SIT UP ON THE STEEL TA CLOSE ON HIS PURPLED FEET - as they hit the linoleum, mov stiffly across the floor. Hearing this, ELIZABETH stops. Slowly, she TURNS...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN THRUSTS HIS ARMS OUT, TAKING HER BY THE HEAD, SQUEEZ
dialogues.text: HARD, AS IF TO CRUSH HER SKULL! He puts his BLEEDING EYE SOCKETS right up to her face, when his voice rushes out i raging whisper...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: All must diel!!! INT. SPOONER’S HOSPITAL ROOM A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM ECHOES down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Elizabeth! NICK races out the door. MALONE follows, glancing back at SPOONER.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Stay here. We're not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE squeals around a corner, driving too fast, when.so guy DARTS OUT INTO THE STREET! SHE SLAMS ON THE BRAKES, b it’s too late. SHE HITS THE GUY, who tumbles up onto her hood. He looks and their eyes meet -- it’s SPOONER! He rolls off and hits the ground running, high-tailing it away from the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE enters, JOURNAL in hand, sees NICK and TOM MALONE standing with ELIZABETH in the hall.  64.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Am I in an alternate universe today, or what? Brett Spooner just ran in front of my car and practically killed himself! MALONE eyeballs NICK and ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Walking dead, huh? What'd you do, plan the whole thing so your pal could run off? That's sick. MALONE turns to go. STEVIE walks after him...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Sheriff! Can I talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: (blowing her off) Not now, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (loud and firm) Now! MALONE stops. He turns to STEVIE, ready to ream her, when

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Patrick Thomas Malone. Who was he? MALONE’S eyes meet STEVIE’S, suddenly softening...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: My great grand-dad. One of the Town Fathers. Why? STEVIE thrusts out the journal. MALONE stares at it, a boyish look of wonder in his eyes as he takes it in his hands, literally caressing the name on the cover...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: You found it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: It found me. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: This? It’s our heritage. The founding families. Their stories. My father told us this book was lost forever.  65. He's clinging to it like it was worth its weight in gold.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Your brother didn’t quite see it that way.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: I‘m not surprised. Bobby turned his back on the family a long time ago. (then) Did you read any of it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: No. MALONE offers the book back to STEVIE...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: What do you plan to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (pushing it back at him) Oh no. I want you to have it. I don't want that thing anywhere near me or my son.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Well. Thank you for this, Stevie. It means the world to me and my family. It’1l be a big part of the anniversary celebration. I promise you that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK walks to the front doors with ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You don’t believe me either, do you. NICK . You’re okay. And'you’re with me. That's all that matters. Suddenly, she puts her arm out, stopping him. She nods towards the doors, THROUGH WHICH THEY SEE: TOM MALONE saying goodbye to STEVIE in the parking lot...  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-.and as STEVIE pulls away in her convertible, TOM MALON looks down at the JOURNAL, before offhandedly CHUCKING TH THING through the open window of his truck. Then he hitches up his pants and walks across the street the Frosty Freeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH grabs NICK by the hand, the fight returning to eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH moves along the side of MALONE’S TRUCK, using N as a screen. She reaches in and STEALS THE JOURNAL.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Got it. Let’s go. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEL SLOAN, a meteorologist, turns from his bank of glowin electronics as DAN 0’BANNON comes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What’s up, Melly boy.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: Dan the man. I thought Tony was comin’ in tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We traded shifts so I could do the party tomorrow. You goin’? SLOAN gets up, slips on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: Don’t think so. Weather’s gonna suck. Check out this big ass fog bank. It’s just perched out there. DAN comes over, eyes the scope.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: I know, right? I think I‘1l plana little indoor activity. With Jolene, if you know what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I can imagine... See ya later, buddy. SLOAN leaves. DAN sits down at the scope, his eyes get bi CLOSE ON THE SCOPE - the FOG registers as a GROWING GREEN BLOB, EXPANDING across the entire screen...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Now that’s some fog. DAN picks up his phone... INT. STEVIE’S CONVERTIBLE - NIGHT STEVIE drives the winding road to the Lighthouse, when he celphone rings. She checks the display: DAN. She shakes her head, lets it go to voicemail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE races by our position, and as she disappears down road, CAMERA BOOMS UP SLOWLY TO REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLACK OCEAN, vast in its expanse, as far as the eye c see... ...and in the distance, A PALE, UNEARTHLY GLOW is beginni to rise, spanning the horizon. Its range is impossible to gauge, but one thing is for sure. It’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLEACHERS are filled with townsfolk. KATHY is seated the dais, surrounded by the MAYOR, TOWN SELECTMEN, TOM MALONE, etc. She searches the crowd, disappointed when sh doesn’t see Elizabeth. [maybe there’s an empty seat]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rag-tag HIGH SCHOOL BAND finishes (poorly) the last str of the Star Spangled Banner. A fat, bald GUY steps up to mic on the podium.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: The Antonio Bay High School Marching Band. Let’s give ‘ema hand. And now, I'd like to introduce the President of the our chamber of commerce, the organizer of this weekend's festivities, and a lovely lady. Ms. Kathy Williams. APPLAUSE from the audience. KATHY smiles, basking in it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Thank you. You’re too kind. All of you. Really. And welcome to the opening ceremonies as Antonio Bay honors its glorious past... More applause. She loves this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO LITTLE BOYS play on a swing set in the kiddie-park. W hear it CREAKING as they go back and forth. Back and fort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENTLY, it overtakes them from behind, temporarily obscuring them from view... ...but when has passed, ONLY ONE LITTLE BOY IS LEFT SWING He looks over to swing beside him which just a moment ago occupied his friend... CLOSE ON THE EMPTY SWING - dangling at the end of its cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is virtually empty. It’s filled with nick-nack bric-a-brac from Antonio Bay’s past (old photos, etc)] ELIZABETH sits at a booth in a dark corner, the JOURNAL o before her. NICK comes to the table with two mugs of beer

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Listen to this. “February 9. Met with Blake for the first time. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH (cont'd) He stood in the shadows to prevent me from getting a clear look at his face. What a vile disease this is! He is a rich man with a cursed condition, but this does not prevent him from trying to better his situation and that of his comrades at the colony.”

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: The colony? NICK pulls the PHOTOGRAPHS from between the pages, begins examining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHY is getting busy...

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: ..-and all of us living here today, owe a debt of gratitude to those men and women who, a hundred years ago, struggled and gave of themselves to make this town grow and prosper into what it is today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH turns the page:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: ‘“Blake’s proposition is simple. He wants to move off Tanzier Island and relocate the entire colony to a fifty-acre plot, just north of here. For their transport, he has purchased a clipper ship called the... (she stops, rattled) Elizabeth Dane.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (reassuring) Hey. It’s a queen’s name. They were always naming ships Elizabeth this and Elizabeth that back then. Just a coincidence, that’s all. She looks at him, wondering, then goes hungrily back to t book. NICK gets up, taking one of the PHOTOGRAPHS with hi

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Elizabeth. Look at this.  70. She gets up and goes to him. Hanging on the wall, isa FRAMED PHOTO, taken from roughly the same vantage point a the one in NICK'S hand (which is dated 1905)... ...only in this photograph, THE TOWN HAS GROWN into a buz little community. BUILDINGS and STORES now line Main Stre PEOPLE on the sidewalks, early automobiles and horse-and- buggies, and we may even notice the CHURCH under construc up on the hill. It is dated 1907 - a mere two years later. They look at e other... ‘ELIZABETH Let’s to talk to the other Malone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACHEN walks along the sand with his metal detector. Suddenly, we hear the thing go crazy -- BEEP, BEEP, BEEP. kneels down, starts digging... ...when he notices a PALE GLOWING on the sand. He stops digging, looks up slowly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDY stands alone on the beach. He looks off towards the ocean, anticipation in his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He‘s dwarfed by A TOWERING WALL OF PULSING FOG. Thirty fe away. NOW TWENTY... InT. LIGHTHOUSE - NIGHT STEVIE hurries in, goes to her COMPUTER, as the last seco of pre-recorded music expire. She pulls the mic to her li

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Ahoy, Mateys. Stevie here, hoping you enjoyed that commercial-free block on KAB, Antonio Bay... INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT MRS. KOBRITZ puts Andy’s dinner on the table. The RADIO plays in b.g.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I’ve got some more tunes lined up to take us through till midnight, and we'll get this party started right after we pay the bills...(go to commercial) EXT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - DECK - NIGHT MRS. KOBRITZ comes out onto the deck overlooking the beac SEES THE FOG, pushing right up to where ANDY stands.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: Oh my. Andy! Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when ANDY turns to face us, a SURGING REVENANT OF FOG SPLITS ITSELF FROM THE MASS, moving faster than the rest, coming at him from behind...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What're we having? The REVENANT moves unnaturally, right up on him now...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: Chicken and french fries.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Cool! He takes off towards the house without turning back, as T FOG CHANGES SHAPE, seeming to gather energy... Following him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SANDY COVE
dialogues.text: THE FOG SWIRLS as it moves on, and when the cove clears, that’s left behind is MACHEN’S METAL DETECTOR, laying the in the sand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE’S cell phone rings. DAN again. Irritating.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Yes, Dan. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN eats a sandwich.  72.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How's my girl?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What is it this time, Dan. Swarm of locusts? Tornado, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Nope. Just fog.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Swallowed us up out here at the station a few minutes ago. Movin’ your way. Kinda cool, actually.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec. STEVIE hits the lights in the station, leaving only the e glow of the electronics. She looks out the window: STEVIE’S POV - The THROBBING GLOW OF THE FOG, moving down coast...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yo! What’s the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: There’s something funky about this fog, Dan. It glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FOG completely covers the windows behind DAN.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It what? Oh, I see. You popa little something to keep you goin’. Gives you a little freak-on, I like that in a woman... Suddenly the LIGHTS in the weather station GO OUT!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey!  73.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: What? DAN stares in shock at his electronics.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The lights just went out. Everything's dead. SOMETHING sweeps across the window behind him and then...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (turns to the door) What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE is still staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What is it? What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Somebody’s at the door.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Dan. Listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: . DAN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna check it out. Hold on, sweetheart. DAN puts down the phone and stands up. CAMERA MOVES IN to the handset, and we HEAR STEVIE on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Dan! DAN! DAN grabs a kerosene lantern off the shelf, lights it, brightening the room. He moves towards the door...

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK
dialogues.text: DAN stops, staring at the SWIRLING MIST outside the windo The SHADOWS play tricks, SOMETHING BACKLIT, MOVING out there...  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE can hear the POUNDING over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA moves towards the door. More POUNDING. The GLOW around the doorframe INTENSIFIES.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What is this, a joke? (towards the phone) Whoever it is, they’re not gonna like my sense of humor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE shouts into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: DAN! DON’T OPEN THE DOOR!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN grabs the doorknob. He PULLS THE DOOR OPEN, AND... Nothing. Save for a wall of PALE, WHITE FOG. He peers int it, certain he sees MOVEMENT out there...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yo! Who's there? Silence. DAN turns, yelling towards the phone again.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I think some fool got drunk and started taking this hundred-year crap a little too seriously. Here I come, asshole! He steps out into The Fog, COMPLETELY DISAPPEARING. There a long, insufferable beat, when SUDDENLY, we HEAR GLASS . BREAKING...

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: There’s a WUMPH sound, familiar somehow, and then...  75.

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE FIREBALL COMES HURTLING BACK THROUGH THE DOOR WITH
dialogues.text: TREMENDOUS FORCE, only this fireball is SCREAMING!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE listens in horror over the phone, when a SMASHING SOUND breaks the silence, like all the glass in the weatherstation JUST SHATTERED! Then... Dead silence. She listens. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (weak) Dan... STEVIE hangs up. Freaked. Thinks. Punches her cell phone, HOME pops on the display... Puts the phone to her ear, bu the call won't go through. Nothing but SCRATCHY STATIC... So she picks up the land line and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a GLOW on the pole as THE FOG swirls up the base, moving methodically towards the mass of wires at the top. INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT The PHONE RINGS. MRS. KOBRITZ is watching Wheel of Fortun

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: andy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE squeezes the phone, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: C'mon! Pick up!!! INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT ANDY sits on his bed, staring out the window. The lights off, but there is a faint GLOWING on his face, coming fro just outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG achieves the top of the telephone pole. A thick R OF MIST forming a noose around the main cluster of wires.  76. INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT MRS. KOBRITZ moves over to the phone, reaching blindly fo it, if she could only take her eyes off the tube...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the TENSILE POPS as the wires SNAP!!! INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT MRS. KOBRITZ finally finds the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone goes dead in STEVIE’S hand. She jiggles the cradle. Nothing. She slams the receiver down in frustration. She stands for a moment by the window, then looks out again. Sees THE FOG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re on top of a hillside, looking down into a STAND OF TREES. Nothing unusual here. But a moment later, the fore begins to GLOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .THE FOG surges towards a huge METAL WATER TANK, perched the hill above the town. CLOSE ON A RED VALVE-HANDLE - as THE FOG creeps over, IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the leading edge of the Fog MOVES ON, FINGERS spreadin every direction, creeping forward like a vaporous army on move... Unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHY is wrapping up her interminable speech, as young VOLUNTEERS pass out candles to the CROWD of townspeople seated in the bleechers...  77.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: ..-and as we think back across the years, I'd like for each of us to keep in mind how important this night is to every citizen in Antonio Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conerete and steel. The THRUM of turbines and generators comes from inside. A LIT SIGN in front reads: ANTONIO BAY

dialogues.speaker: POWER AND LIGHT
dialogues.text: Slowly, THE FOG rises up over the sign, DEVOURING it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK'S truck roars PAST CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GLOWING FOG moves out of the woods, rolling towards t road. We see HEADLIGHTS coming at us from around a curve, the FOG moves closer, pressing up onto the shoulder, almo to the asphalt now, when... NICK'S TRUCK flies right by... one split second before TH FOG swirls over the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH sits close to NICK, still reading from the jour in her lap:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: “April 20. Cannot sleep. My mind is filled with the abomination of what my conspirators and I have planned. The twelve of us met tonight behind locked doors. From midnight until one o’clock, we plotted the death of Blake and his comrades.” ’ NICK looks out the window, as they drive past the site the FOR SALE sign stands.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (realizing) Fifty acres. Two miles north. This is it! (turns. to her) This was their land.  78. INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT ANDY moves to his window. Outside, we see a REVENANT OF F moving around the sill, searching for a way in. ANDY taps the glass. The FOG stops, cocks its “head”, as if curious then... EXT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT The FOG dips below the windowsill, still searching. We FL WITH IT, as it hugs the foundation, investigating the possibilities. Finally it wafts out to the street, rollin over the curb, hugging the gutter... . flowing down into the sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPINES OF THE FOG surround the building, each acting independently of the next, all seeking a point of entry. There’s a CRACKED WINDOW in the back. One SPINE OF FOG “turns”, as if to notify its counterparts, which QUICKLY MERGE into a SWIRLING MASS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG seeps in through the broken window, drifting towa the GENERATORS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE flips a switch, brings the mic to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: This is Stevie on KAB. There’s a problem with the phones here at the station, maybe everywhere, I don’t know, so I’m gonna hope somebody's listening... INT. NICK’S PICKUP TRUCK - NIGHT NICK turns up the RADIO...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: ...there’s an emergency in the coast guard weather station on old Russleville Road. There’s a good chance somebody's hurt pretty bad out there...  79.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We’re close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing a turnoff, NICK’S TRUCK SCREECHES TO A STOP, back and turns the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG splits into TWO DISTINCT TENDRILS, curling sharpl allowing themselves to be SUCKED INTO THE GUTS OF THE DUA TURBINES. ZAAAAAAAAP! THERE‘S A HUGE FLOWING ARC OF ELECTRICITY BEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker and die. The electronics DRONE to a st STEVIE checks her console. Everything's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTHOUSE BEACON goes out, grinding to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, this has no effect on the lights inside th station. STEVIE gets up, looks out the window, sees Anton Bay has gone dark, and THE FOG, moving down the coast, po to swallow it whole...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Screw this. She picks up her car keys and goes. “EXT. MAIN STREET - NIGHT The town has gone dark. Signs, buildings -- everything. T only light is from the flickering of the fifty or so cand in the bleachers. KATHY and the others look confused. TOM MALONE gets up.  80.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. Just a power failure. Probably temporary. You can thank Gray Davis... INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT The lights are out. MRS. KOBRITZ stands at the glass door looking out, her face illuminated by the PALE GLOW of THE FOG.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: This is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: I think we better close all the windows. Check your bedroom. I/11 check your mother’s. As they turn for the bedrooms, we HOLD on the GLASS DOORS THE FOG rises up the panes, swirling, flowing, AND WITHIN WE COULD SWEAR WE SEE FACES - HAUNTED FACES - PEERING IN. INT. CRAWLSPACE - STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT WE’RE CLOSE ON A SLOW-DRIPPING PIPE as a WATER DROPLET fo then falls, forms, then falls... Suddenly, the dripping stops. An TINY PUFF OF FOG leaks o then we HEAR THE PIPES MOAN as it passes through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station is dark and quiet. EVERY WINDOW IS SHATTERED, but there is no sign of THE FOG. Through the open door, we see NICK’S PICKUP drive up. He ELIZABETH get out. They come in through the open door and we hear GLASS CRUNCHING underfoot. ELIZABETH clicks on the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody here?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Be careful, there’s glass everywhere. ELIZABETH stays right beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What is that smell?  81. They cross the room, assaying the damage, when WE HEAR: SPLAT. SPLAT. SPLAT. ELIZABETH’S flashlight finds a GOOEY RED LIQUID, pooling the floor... She RAISES the beam, looking for the source...FINDING IT!

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: DAN'S SCORCHED BODY hangs there, LODGED IN THE DRYWALL, H BURNT, SHRUNKEN FEATURES CLINGING TO HIS SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE gets into her car. THE FOG is coming towards her, bearing down, ODDLY LIT every few seconds by the LIGHTHOU BEACON. She looks behind her as she fumbles the key into the ignition, seeing nothing but white. She hits a button, wh raises the CONVERTIBLE TOP, slowly...slowly. She winds up the windows now, which close just as THE FOG swallows the car. STEVIE turns the key. The engin kicks over, but won’t catch. INSERT - UNDER THE CAR‘S HOOD THE FOG seeps in around the grille, following the injecto lines, and as STEVIE cranks the engine, it PENETRATES THE INTAKE . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries once more, but it’s not happening. Outside, in PULSING WHITE, she sees that familiar MOVEMENT in the mis IMAGES rushing past, when SUDDENLY, THERE’S A POUNDING ON GLASS...

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK
dialogues.text: STEVIE screams, makes a checking 360...but there’s nobody there... INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT MRS. KOBRITZ stands in the kitchen. She strikes a match, lights a few CANDLES, when she hears a strange GURGLING coming from the sink.  82. She picks up one of the candles, leans down to get a bett look...

dialogues.speaker: THE SINK
dialogues.text: The drain is backing up. The garbage disposal begins coughing up dark, scummy water.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KOBRITZ
dialogues.text: Shit. She gets a plunger from under the sink and goes to work, the PIPES begin to rattle and groan... She leans down again, inspecting, but the drain is still clogged. Some greasy bubbles rise ominously to the surfac Reluctantly, she pushes up her sleeve and sticks her hand up to the elbow, grimacing, feeling around for a long bea Finally there comes a look on her face as if she’s found problem, when Her arm is tugged by something unseen. There’s a puzzled look on her face, and then KERSPLASH!!! Her arm is jerked violently down the drain, SUBMERSING HER FACE in the DARK WATER. BUBBLES ROIL as th old woman screams and struggles beneath the surface, as s is JERKED DOWN AGAIN, HARDER AND HARDER, when... SUDDENLY the THRASHING STOPS. We're behind her now, as she stands up, gasping for breat hair dripping unctuous water on her bright pant-suit... HER POV - as she pulls her arm from the water...

dialogues.speaker: GANGRENOUS TISSUE.
dialogues.text: She TURNS TO FACE US NOW, A STEAMING MONSTROSITY OF GREEN ROTTING FLESH AND YELLOW OOZING PUS. She reaches up to touch her face, but the skin only comes to the bone. Her rotting lips curl away as her false teet drop from her mouth and hit the floor. y  83. INT. STEVIE’S CAR - NIGHT STEVIE tries to start the car one last time. Hopeless. Outside, the weird strobing of the lighthouse beacon continues, BUT WHAT SHE DOESN’T SEE, are tiny wisps of TH FOG, SEEPING-IN THROUGH THE VENTS IN THE DASH... Before she can react, tendrils of the stuff surge in, mov past her shoulders, LOCKING THE DOORS! THE FOG jerks the seatbelt out of its reel, PINNING STEVI HER SEAT BY THE THROAT. HER SEAT SLIDES BACK - her feet can no longer touch the brakes, The GEARSHIFT POPS INTO NEUTRAL and the CAR BEGINS TO ROL (towards the cliff above the ocean which we can’t see, bu know is there)... With one hand clutching at the belt around her neck, STEV grabs the parking brake with the other. THE FOG fights he for it, rasping at her fingers, turning them bloody, unti she finally must let go. The car keeps rolling, building momentum now, as STEVIE S

dialogues.speaker: DEFROSTER.
dialogues.text: She hits it full blast. Her hair BLOWS BACK. THE FOG make a weird, almost child-like SOUND as the warm air from the defrosters hits. THE FOG seems to diminish somehow, and in that instant, s pulls the seatbelt from around her neck,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FRONT WHEELS of the slow-rolling car drop. The car sk out over cliff’s edge. INT. STEVIE’S CONVERTIBLE - NIGHT She finds the doorhandle, and JUMPS out, falling, falling until she SMACKS down on a tiny outcropping. Visibility ZERO, she backs away from the ledge, hugging t wall of the cliff, when out of the WHITE VOID ABOVE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT CAMERA LOW TO THE FLOOR ~- TEETH IN F.G.

dialogues.speaker: AS MRS. KOBRITZ' LIES ON THE FLOOR, THE VAPOROUS STEAM ST
dialogues.text: RISING OFF HER HEAD, BEGINNING TO MASS NOW, rising up as sensing something or someone else in the room...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Who stands in the doorway, FRIGHTENED beyond belief. He r down the hall into his room, slams the door. INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT He stands there, trembling and afraid, his eyes on the li coming under the crack of his door.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: As a thin wisp of THE FOG appears underneath. ANDY rips the covers off his bed, stuffs them under the crack, seemingly quashing the threat, when...

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK
dialogues.text: He backs away from the door, wanting to panic. Instead, h rushes over to his desk, searching for something, until h finds a roll of SCOTCH TAPE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered and bruised, STEVIE claws her way back up and ov the cliff. She looks for the BEACON ON THE LIGHTHOUSE, locates it, gets to her feet... AND MAKES A RUN FOR IT, the BEACON her only compass. WEIRD SHAPES AND IMAGES WISK PAST IN THE ETHER, reaching for her as she runs, snatching at her hair, her clothes, blinding her in all the white...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE bursts in, SLAMS the door, slides the bolt across. She opens a storage closet, shoves some rags under the cr in the door. She goes over, rips a tarp off the lighthouse’s auxiliary generator. She YANKS the cord. The thing sputters. She YANKS again.  85. In a frenzy, she pulls the generator cord over and over.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Please start... Please... Suddenly, the generator SPUTTERS to life, HUMMING steadil The lights come back on. STEVIE runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE rushes over to the microphone, turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Please. If anybody can hear me. Anybody! Please go check on my son. It’s 887 White Beach Road. I can't get through to him on the phone and... It is all too much for her. It takes everything she’s got keep from going to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: .-.I can’t get there. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and ELIZABETH ride in the cab, racing THE FOG which SURGES UP BEHIND THEM. INT. NICK’S PICKUP TRUCK - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: ...it’s 887 White Beach Road. If anybody can hear me, please hurry.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We’ve gotta turn around.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You can’t even see the road. We’11 never make it through.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (indefatigable) Then we’1l find another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK’S TRUCK turns off the paved road, blasting onto the rutted dirt logging road.  86.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I‘m gonna need your eyes, here.

dialogues.speaker: THRU THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: FLYING over the washboard road, blasting in and out of th patchy fog -- racing past trees one second, FLYING BLIND

dialogues.speaker: NEXT
dialogues.text: WE EMERGE to find ourselves headed for a steep drop-off a edge of the winding road. NICK CRANKS THE WHEEL! THE HEADLIGHTS find the road again, but only for an insta and WE’RE IN THE FOG AGAIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enshrouded in fog, the truck SIDESWIPES a tree, continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG rolls down a hill in a silent avalanche. Out ahea of it, we can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the YELLOW CAUTION LIGHTS of a POWER AND LIGHT REPAIR TRUCK, parked on the side of the road. One LINEMAN is up on the POLE as the OTHER leans against truck, eating a sandwich. Over his shoulder, we can see A BAR OF FOG moving unnaturally...

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN
dialogues.text: We got power up to here. Trouble’s gotta be at the substation. The OTHER GUY grunts. THE FOG makes a turn, as if hearing this, sweeping his way. THE GUY looks up at his buddy, takes a bite of his sandwi when we see A SLITHERING TENDRIL OF THE FOG SNAKE ITS WAY RIGHT UP HIS NOSE. The GUY blinks, wipes his nose, checks his sleeve. Then, turns and matter-of-factly grabs the levers of the lift bucket and PULLS. The LINEMAN is being THRUST UP towards the hi-voltage wir He looks down over the edge of the bucket.  87.

dialogues.speaker: LINEMAN
dialogues.text: Lucius! What the hell’re you doin!

dialogues.speaker: KILL THE LIFT
dialogues.text: The bucket crushes him into the wires. THERE’S A LOUD HUM

dialogues.speaker: LIFT, BLASTING LUCIUS 50 YARDS IN THE AIR, KILLING HIM DE
dialogues.text: And as he lies there quivering, THE FOG SLIPS OUT THROUGH NOSTRIL and moves on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG has moved inland, drifting between the houses, co up the side streets. EXT. MALONE’S TRUCK - NIGHT MALONE opens the passenger door of his truck, grabs a FLASHLIGHT off the seat, when he suddenly realizes the. JOURNAL is gone. He checks the floor, under the seat, etc He thinks for a second, pissed, then slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALONE walks past the still-full bleachers, takes the sta

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to break this up, folks. The power should’ve been on by now. The fog’s movin’ in and I think it’s best everybody just go on home. Okay? Drive safe, now. KATHY looks crestfallen. TOM puts his hand on her shoulde

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Don’t go anywhere. You and I may have a problem... She looks up at him, concerned. Behind her, the townspeop rise, emptying the bleachers, pointing here and there at FOG rolling in, when SOMEBODY STARTS SCREAMING! Just inside the ADVANCING WALL OF FOG is A MAN, seemingly trapped, flailing away as HE’S SWEPT DOWN THE STREET! HE DESPERATELY REACHES OUT to MALONE with one arm that somehow remains clear of the PULSING MIST.  88. MALONE GRABS HIS HAND, staying out ahead of the stuff, tr to pull the man free! MALONE’S POV - INTO THE FOG SWIRLING IMAGES OF THE MAN’S TORMENTED FACE IN EXCRUCIATI

dialogues.speaker: PAIN.
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE MAN’S HAND THE FINGERS CLAMP DOWN ON MALONE’S HAND IN A DEATH GRIP,

dialogues.speaker: TRYING TO PULL HIM IN
dialogues.text: MALONE REARS BACK, PULLING AWAY FOR ALL HE’S WORTH, WHEN.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARM COMES OFF
dialogues.text: MALONE FALLS BACK, scrambling away from THE FOG, THE ARM STILL TWITCHING IN THE STREET... PEOPLE are RUNNING FROM THE BLEACHERS now, FATHERS, MOTHE AND CHILDREN, SCATTERING IN ALL DIRECTIONS, SCREAMING, tr to avoid THE FOG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOARD of people run into the RAINY ALE. HANK JONES stan at the door, waving people inside. A FAT WOMAN runs for the door, THE FOG right on her heels -eating up the space between them.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: c’mon! RUN! And right before his eyes, THE WOMAN VANISHES. Not so muc swallowed by THE FOG, as JERKED INTO IT, her arms flailin in surprise... HANK blinks in disbelief, when somebody pulls him inside shuts the door. INT. NICK’S PICKUP TRUCK - NIGHT Barrelling down the road. ELIZABETH points out the window

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: THRU TRUCK WINDOW
dialogues.text: A STREETSIGN in the headlights: WHITE BEACH ROAD.  89.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, WHITE BEACH ROAD
dialogues.text: The truck SQUEALS a hard turn, races on. INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT ANDY sits on the bed, clutching his pillow. He’s paralyze with fear, eyes wide and fixated on THE DOOR - A MESS OF SCOTCH TAPE now plastered around the entire frame. The PULSING LIGHT OF THE FOG is coming in o all sides now, not just the bottom. CLOSE ON A SECTION OF TAPE, BEGINNING TO PEEL BACK and no can hear WATER DRIPPING on the other side, when...

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK
dialogues.text: EXT. NICK’S TRUCK - STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE - NIGHT Nick’s truck screeches to a stop at the rear of the beach house. NICK jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Get behind the wheel. Keep the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Nick! NICK! But he’s already racing towards the house. She scoots ove into the driver’s seat, puts her hand on the gearshift. S lifts her fingers, checks the LITTLE SHIFT DIAGRAM on the handle. The reaches up to adjust the rearview, slowly turns... HER POV - THE FOG is coming up the road behind her. EXT. STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE ~ NIGHT NICK runs up to a window and shines the flashlight in. Nothing. He checks another window. Then a third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDY sitting on his bed, staring at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking in. HE BREAKS THE GLASS. Shards fly onto the bed. ANDY looks back with wild eyes to see NICK TRYING TO CLIMB IN, but the opening is too high. He sticks his arm through the broken glass, reaches out to A

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come on! But ANDY is too scared to move. OVER HIS SHOULDER, NICK s

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: ANDY looks at NICK, then back at the DOOR... ...as the tape is ripped away. The door OPENS to reveal a

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMMIT, KID
dialogues.text: AND AS THE THING APPROACHES THE BED, ANDY finally leaps u NICK grabs his hand and PULLS HIM OUT! EXT. NICK’S TRUCK - STEVIE’S BEACH HOUSE ~- NIGHT NICK races back to the truck with ANDY in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hit it! ELIZABETH GRINDS THE GEARS, finally finding one. She jams the gas. The truck rocks forward, but it’s not moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BACK TIRES WHIRR, spinning and smoking and sinking do into the soft sand under them as... THE FOG moves in, only a few feet from them now.  91. INT. NICK’S TRUCK - NIGHT ELIZABETH frantically guns the engine. The truck rocks ba and forth, tires WHINING, going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: YOU CAN DO IT
dialogues.text: EXT. NICK’S TRUCK - NIGHT The back tires just sink deeper. THE FOG is now inches aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we see THE FOG as it reaches the truc AND THE WRITHING SEAWEED-THING walking through it, not te feet away from them now. ELIZABETH slams the truck into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH tries to shove it into first. The gears GRIND! NICK looks out the window. The THING IS RIGHT THERE IN TH

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: She gets the truck into gear, GRITS HER TEETH and PUNCHES

dialogues.speaker: THAN A BLACK, UNDULATING TANGLE OF SEAWEED, OOZING YELLOW
dialogues.text: FLUID ALL OVER THE WINDSHIELD (same stuff as was on journ With an emotionless face, ELIZABETH turns on the wipers. SEAWEED slides up the window and flies off. Nick notices her hands, trembling on the steering wheel. reaches over ANDY, puts his arm around her.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck roars off into the distance -- away from THE FO BUT WE HOLD on the TANGLE OF SEAWEED and when THE FOG waf over it, IT BEGINS TO THROB AND SQUIRM, CONTORTING BACK I ITS ORIGINAL FORM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE OF TAILLIGHTS lines road out of town. But this lin of traffic is not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUSHING WATER from the compromised tank has WASHED OUT TH ROAD. TOWNSPEOPLE stand by their cars on the edge of the broken asphalt, peering down at the sluicing mud. Panicke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE looks out the window, devastated by what she sees: HER POV - THE FOG SPREADS INLAND, COVERING EVERYTHING. She unclamps the microphone, clutching it in her bleeding hand, despondent and scared...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Andy. I don’t even know if... if you can hear me. I’m sorry I didn’t come for you. If you're safe...if you can hear these words...get to the old church on the hill, however you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK’S TRUCK hurtles along a street leading back into tow INT. NICK’S TRUCK - NIGHT NICK, ELIZABETH and ANDY listen to the radio:

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: ...the fog is moving inland, like a wall. It’s everywhere. The church is the only place above The Fog. For now. ELIZABETH slams on the brakes and the truck swaps ends, ROCKING TO A STOP.  93. THROUGH THE WINDOW, we can see THE FOG coming directly towards us, over houses and parked cars, quietly gobbling everything in its path.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Back up and take a left! The gears GRIND. ELIZABETH growls. She smiles at him, then slams the truck into gear. All business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER MALONE walks among the headstones in the CEMETERY, bottle of whiskey in his hand, obviously drunk. He reache the edge of the graveyard, stopping at a particularly elaborate stone, engraved thusly: PATRICK THOMAS MALONE FATHER MALONE takes a pull from the bottle, looks down at FOG, like a pulsing lid on the valley below.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to stop it now... He takes a SKELETON KEY from his pocket, drops it on the ‘ground beside the headstone...

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Father? SPOONER stands there, six rolls of duct tape on his arms, like bracelets. FATHER MALONE turns, not recognizing him.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: It's me. Brett Spooner. You've gotta get inside, Father. INT. NICK’S TRUCK - POV THROUGH WINDSHIELD - NIGHT Through the windshield, we pass the cemetery, arriving at church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK, ELIZABETH and ANDY get out of the truck. ELIZABETH takes a quick look back down the hill. HER POV - The GLOWING FOG seems to be SWELLING, moving up hill towards the church.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let’s get inside. NICK pushes on the door, but it’s locked. He BANGS ON IT.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it? NICK looks at ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Spooner?

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: You’re not Spooner.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Open the fuckin’ door, Spooner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church is dark, lit only by the flickering of flames the big stone fireplace. FATHER MALONE stands staring out one of the front windows. SPOONER pulls open the door and they rush inside, shut the doors behind them.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Where the hell’ve you been?

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: (indicating the tape) Hardware store, for starters.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Father? MALONE just looks out the window, a thousand-yard-stare. match MALONE in lighthouse in opening) ELIZABETH walks up to him, the JOURNAL in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (shaking him) Father! Is there a cellar in here? A basement? Anything.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: We can’t hide from it... She pulls out the photo of the founding fathers.  95.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: All must die. What does that mean, Father. Who are these men?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: No matter where we go, it will find us. .

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What did they do? What happened a hundred years ago?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: A lie. A whole town, built on betrayal. And now they’ve come back to make us pay. (looks right at her) It’s judgement day.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What the hell’re are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what he’s talking about. TOM MALONE comes in with KATHY, starts walking towards ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: A figment of a drunk’s imagination. A wives’ tale on the lips of a dying old man, passed down from generation to generation. TOM MALONE takes the journal from ELIZABETH. She stares daggers at her mother, but KATHY won’t meet her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Time to put all that to rest, once and for all, He throws the JOURNAL into the fire. [efx] FATHER MALONE watches this, almost a smile on his face. ANDY stands at the window.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s people out there! ELIZABETH joins ANDY at the window.  96.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CHURCH WINDOW
dialogues.text: THE FOG is coming up through the trees. DEEP WITHIN ITS GLOW, we can see DARK SHAPES swirling in the mist, on the march towards the church.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Those aren't people.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: There’s a cellar in the back. Bring the boy and follow me. MALONE tries the door.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: It‘s locked. Where's the key, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: Afraid of a wives’ tale, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Gimme the god damn key! ANDY stands by the window, still looking out.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Andy. Move away, honey. ELIZABETH shoves a cabinet in front of the window, when CRAAASH! We hear a WINDOW SHATTER on the other side of th locked. door.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Malone! MALONE turns, SPOONER throws him a roll of duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: It’s out there. And we gotta keep it out. I’ve seen what it can do.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: A lecture from my favorite fugitive.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER,
dialogues.text: You wanna live through this, or not? Growing nervous now, TOM MALONE strips some tape from the roll and starts in on the door.  37. KATHY walks up to ELIZABETH, tries to touch her shoulder. ELIZABETH ducks out from under it. TOM MALONE rips more tape, turns to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Help me. FATHER MALONE looks at him flatly, takes a swig from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: You coward. You've always been a coward. You know what your problem is? You care too much. Look where it’s gotten you, Bobby. Then look where I am. You know why? Cause I don’t give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and SPOONER have finished taping the front doors. Th pick up a heavy wooden PEW, lodge it against the frame. The whole place is starting to GLOW, completely surrounde THE FOG, when...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH runs towards the window. NICK practically tackl her from behind. She tears herself away, runs over to the window. THE FOG THROBS AND SWIRLS just outside, but DOESN’T COME IN...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Get somthing in front of that window!!! TENDRILS OF THE STUFF PEER IN, as if sizing things up, sussing them out...  98. THEY ALL STARE AT IT, afraid to move, afraid not to, and then, we could almost swear IT SOMEHOW LOOKS PLEASED. May even smiles, when...

dialogues.speaker: LONG CURTAINS ON FIRE. SMOKE BEGINS TO BILLOW,
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH runs over, tries to put it out... FATHER MALONE moves to the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE JOURNAL, lying there in the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE stands in the lighthouse window, the mic still in hand. STEVIE . I’m gonna try to stay on the air as long as I can. I don’t know what’s going on out there, but if one person can hear me... OUTSIDE THE WINDOW - THE FOG rises up, slowly obscuring t windows, giving us the feeling the whole lighthouse is sinking. STEVIE puts the microphone down. She’s through. She picks up the picture of her kid... »..and now, she begins to hear VOICES. Pleading, horrifie voices, garbled by time and unknown dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER, TWISTED IMAGES APPEAR WITHIN THE FOG, SCRATCH
dialogues.text: AT THE GLASS, searching for a way in...

dialogues.speaker: A PAPER-THIN WISP OF FOG SEEPS IN
dialogues.text: And with every pass of the lighthouse beacon, WE CAN SEE AGONIZED FACES AT THE WINDOW -- BLOATED, DROWNED FACES. BURNED FACES. LEPER FACES.  99. She puts her hands over her ears and turns away -- BUT TH IS NO TURNING AWAY. SHE’S TRAPPED IN A 360-DEGREE THEATRE THE MACABRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRE GLOWS IN FATHER MALONE’S EYES. Shielding his fac from the heat, he reaches in with a pair of tongs and pul the JOURNAL from the flames. He drops it at his feet...

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: What the hell’re you doing. And it’s then we notice THE JOURNAL IS COMPLETELY INTACT, if it were untouched by the flames.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: It didn’t burn.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MALONE
dialogues.text: They won't let it burn. And we may notice the GLOWING OUTSIDE the church has ceas ELIZABETH goes over, looks out the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It’s gone. The others come to see for themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FOG is receding, curling away unnaturally, as if in s jerky, reverse motion.

dialogues.speaker: TOM MALONE
dialogues.text: It’s gone, (a little laugh) It's gone! ANDY wraps his arms around ELIZABETH. She looks over at NICK. Something ain’t right.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: Who stands in the center of the room. He looks over at NI with pleading eyes, and then...  100.

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: SPOONER STAGGERS TOWARDS NICK UNDER THE SHOWER OF GLASS,
dialogues.text: MOUTHING “HELP ME” AS HIS INTERNAL ORGANS BOIL UP OUT OF EYE-SOCKETS .

dialogues.speaker: TO BE HIS PELVIS. THE REST IS NOTHING BUT STEAMING GRUE.
dialogues.text: THE FOG CONTINUES TO FORTIFY ITSELF, taking on a predator stance, then slowly, purposefully, turning... ON THE MALONES. Side-by-side at the fireplace. TOM looks at his brother, slowly distancing himself. BUT IT’S NOT BOBBY THE FOG WANTS... TOM MALONE begins to tremble. THE FOG reaches out and touches his face, almost caressing it. It draws him in, examining him now like a piece of meat i butcher shop. Finally, the two of them are face to face, almost as if it is searching for something in TOM MALONE’ eyes...

dialogues.speaker: MALONE IS SUDDENLY YANKED HEAD-FIRST INTO THE BELLY OF TH
dialogues.text: FOG with unimaginable force. His body flops around in mad convulsions as... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and ELIZABETH run outside, joined by ANDY and FATHER MALONE. The Fog has completely lifted from around the church, save for that which now drags TOM off through the trees.  101.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: C'mon. We’ve got to see.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE opens the circuit-breaker panel in the wall, pulls one labelled ‘BEACON’. The “show” outside the windows goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s OPEN. THE DOOR TO THE STAIRS SLAMS SHUT - the only way out. FREAKED, STEVIE goes over, tries the knob, when...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHTS GO OUT
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, STEVIE LETS OUT A YELP. She lifts up her arm, s a SLASH across it... SHE SQUIRMS, as if being contained by forces unseen, something PULLING HER HAIR NOW, arching her head back as.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FOLLOWS A KNIFE
dialogues.text: As it appears from the darkness below her waistline, the glimmering point tracing a line across her flat stomach, and around the curves of her breasts. It slows as it reaches her slender neck, pressing against throat in the shape of a smile, before working its way up cheek, the glinting point rising slowly before her right A TEAR runs down her face. The lock on the door CLICKS. DOOR SWINGS SLOWLY OPEN and whatever it is, LEADS STEVIE OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM MALONE as he’s ripped through the woods by THE FOG, scraping over rocks and stumps, whipsawing madly as if be drawn by a team of wild horses.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE steps out onto the railing, kicking and clawing fo dear life. THE VOICES RISE AGAIN. THE FACES ARE CLOSE ENOUGH TO TOUCH, SWIRLING IN THE MIST. She clings to the rail, desperate for a handhold, fighting for her life. But the thing with the knife SLAMS HER BACK AGAINST THE LIGHTHOUSE WALL, THE KNIFE BLADE jammed against her cheek pushing her face towards the sea, FORCING HER TO LOOK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALONE’S battered body emerges from the woods, finally DROPPED in the middle of a clearing... MALONE looks up, and as THE FOG releases him, it begins t CHANGE FORM, slowly evolving into the image of someone we recognize... BLAKE - THE MAN WHO WAS WRONGED 100 YEARS AGO. Behind him, a WALL OF FOG rolls out of the forest, WITHIN APPEAR ALL THE GHOSTS OF THE ELIZABETH DANE... ...and as WE WIDEN, we see THE FOR SALE SIGN planted in t dirt, and IT’S THEN WE REALIZE THE LEPERS HAVE RETURNED T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered and bruised, MALONE rises to his hands and knees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As NICK, ELIZABETH, ANDY and FATHER MALONE reach the edge the clearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “103. BLAKE’S GHOST stands over TOM MALONE, who tries to crawl away, as...

dialogues.speaker: IT, LIKE WET CEMENT THAT CLINGS TO HIS ARMS AND LEGS IN G
dialogues.text: AND HE’S UP TO HIS CHEST NOW, AND THE MORE HE STRUGGLES, DEEPER HE SINKS...

dialogues.speaker: HE IS GONE.
dialogues.text: BLAKE pulis back his CLOAK, revealing his ghostly, leprou face, and now, ANOTHER GHOST APPEARS. It, too, pulls its cloak back, and we realize this is HIS WIFE. He reaches out to her and she to him. HE PULLS HER CLOSE THEY KISS... ..-and as they do, THEIR LEPROUS SKIN IS HEALED... And for a fleeting moment, we see them in their true form

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE KNIFE AT STEVIE’S THROAT FALLS AWAY, dropping into th ocean far below. She falls back onto the railing and gath herself. The night is clear. The thing with the knife is gone. The is complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: And over black, WE HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t think any of us can really say what happened last night. FADE UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVIE is at her console with the microphone. ANDY plays close by.  104.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Maybe the fog was trying to send us a message. Or maybe it was leading us somewhere... EXT. ELIZABETH’S HOUSE - DAY ELIZABETH locks the front door. She picks up her suitcase comes down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.but if this has been anything more than a nightmare, and if all of us don’t wake up snug and warm in our beds... INT. NICK’S PICKUP TRUCK ~- DAY She gets in, takes NICK’S hand as they drive away.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...look into the darkness across the water. Look for the fog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER MALONE grasps a slab from the stone wall of the church. He pulls it away, revealing a hollow space behind He lays the JOURNAL inside, then SLIDES the big slab back into place, starts cementing it with MORTAR.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It could come again.
